com.yantra.yfc.rcp

Class YRCBaseBehavior

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCBaseBehavior
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IYRCApiCallbackhandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    YRCBehavior, YRCExtentionBehavior

    public abstract class YRCBaseBehavior
extends java.lang.Object
implements IYRCApiCallbackhandler
    The class providing abstract implementation guiding the behavior of a form. It provides a framework for controlling the behavior of the controls and for calling APIs.
    Author:
    statikonda

      • getFieldValue

        public abstract java.lang.String getFieldValue(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the control for which the value needs to be fetched.
        Returns:
        Returns the string value of the control. In case of combo and list boxes, it will be the value corresponding to the code value. If the code value is null, the description value is returned.

      • setFieldValue

        public abstract void setFieldValue(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                   java.lang.Object obj)
        Sets the value of the control on the screen. The set value, if applicable, will be displayed on the screen.
        Parameters:
        fieldName -
        obj - The value that needs to be set on the control. For most of the controls it is a text value. Only in case of radio/check box ,if 'obj' is an instance of Boolean then selection is set according to the boolean value of 'obj'.Otherwise, 'obj' is used to set display text.

        public abstract void setFieldInError(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                     YRCValidationResponse validationResponse)
        Note that the control for displaying the error message should have been set or initialized during form initialization.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the control which is in error.
        validationResponse - The object containing the details of the error.
        See Also:
        YRCPlatformUI.setStatusLineManager(Object), YRCConstants.FORM_ERR_WARN_DISPLAY

      • addFieldInError

        public void addFieldInError(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control control)
        Deprecated. use addFieldInError(Control, String) instead.
        /** Adds the field to the list of controls in error. Adding a field in error will set the behavior in error.
        Parameters:
        control - The control that needs to be set in error.
        See Also:
        addFieldInError(Control)

      • addFieldInError

        public void addFieldInError(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control control,
                            java.lang.String errorMessage)
        A method to add a control in error. If a control is added in error by calling this method manually, its the callers responsibility to remove the field from error. The control is automatically removed from error if it is disposed and hasError() method is called for errors.
        Parameters:
        control - The control that needs to be set in error.
        errorMessage - The error message associated with the control. When called to show erros on the screen, this error message is displayed. If the error message is void, then it is defaulted to the default message derived from the error type.

      • addFieldInError

        public void addFieldInError(java.lang.String fieldName,
                            java.lang.String errorMessage)
        The utitlity method to add a field in error using the control name.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the control that needs to be set in error. The control with the field name doesnot exist, it does nothing.
        errorMessage - The error message that needs to be displayed when showing the field in error.

      • removeFieldInError

        public void removeFieldInError(java.lang.String fieldName)
        This utility method is called when from some control that was in error the error condition has been removed.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The field name of the control that needs to be removed from error. The control with the field name doesnot exist, it does nothing.

        public abstract boolean hasError()

        Returns:
        The boolean value if the screen is in error.

      • showError

        public abstract void showError()
        Message dialog showing the errors in the screen. This will show only one control in error at a time and the focus will go to the control in error. For table if full row selection is provided then the row in error will be highlighted .

      • callApi

        protected void callApi(YRCApiContext ctx)
        Method to call an API. Calling an API consists of the following process:
        • Define the command and the namespace in the commands file
        • Create an instance of YRCApiContext
        • Set the command name
        • Set the input to the api/service.
        • Set the form id of the conext, if required.
        • Call the API.

        Sample code: 
         public void callOrderListAPI(Document inputXml, Control ctrlToDisable) {
        YRCAPIContext context = new YRCAPIContext();
        context.setApiName(APINames.API_GET_ORDER_LIST);
        context.setInputXml(inputXml);
        context.setFormId(getFormId());
        context.setOwnerControl(ctrlToDisable);
        callApi(context);
 }
        Parameters:
        ctx - The API context containing the information for calling an API.

      • callApi

        protected void callApi(YRCApiContext ctx,
                       org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control controlToDisable)
        Parameters:
        ctx - The API context containing the information for calling an API.
        controlToDisable - The control that needs to be disabled while the API call is in progress. If the passed control is null, the form is disabled.
        See Also:
        callApi(YRCApiContext)

      • callApi

        protected void callApi(YRCApiContext ctx,
                       IYRCApiCallbackhandler handler)
        Parameters:
        ctx - The API context containing the information for calling an API.
        handler - The call back handler that provides a hook, which is called when the API call is completed.
        See Also:
        callApi(YRCApiContext)

      • callApi

        protected void callApi(YRCApiContext ctx,
                       org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control controlToDisable,
                       IYRCApiCallbackhandler handler)
        Parameters:
        ctx - The API context containing the information for calling an API.
        controlToDisable - The control that needs to be disabled while the API call is in progress. If the passed control is null, the form is disabled.
        handler - The call back handler that provides a hook, which is called when the API call is completed.
        See Also:
        callApi(YRCApiContext)

      • handleApiCompletion

        public void handleApiCompletion(YRCApiContext ctx)
        The method is meant to be overriden by the subclasses. It is called once an API call is completed.By default it does nothing. Subclasses should use the information contained in the API context to process the API output.
        Specified by:
        handleApiCompletion in interface IYRCApiCallbackhandler
        Parameters:
        ctx - The API context used for calling an API. The context contains all the informations related to the API call. After and API is completed successfully, the output xml of the context is updated. The API status is updated to reflect the status of the api call.
        See Also:
        YRCApiContext

      • handlePostApiCompletion

        public void handlePostApiCompletion(YRCApiContext ctx)
        The method is meant to be overriden by the subclasses. It is called once handleApiCompletion is completed.By default it does nothing. Subclasses should use the information contained in the API context to handle any post processing.

      • pageChanged

        public final boolean pageChanged()
        Utility method to inform editor that its contents have changed and that it should inform all the objects which are listening to editor changes. Possible scenarios where this can be used is to update related views. Example: Outline view in eclipse.
        Returns:
        True if editor has been informed that contents have changed. False otherwise.

        public void apiCallStarted()
        Utility method to inform behavior, that a api call has been started. If this method is invoked by applications then the corresponding method
        See Also:
        should also be invoked. The above methods need not be called by applications if a API call is being made from a behavior class., isAPICallInProgress()

      • apiCallCompleted

        public void apiCallCompleted()
        Utility method to inform behavior, that a api call has completed. If this method is invoked by applications then the corresponding method
        See Also:
        should have been called. The above methods need not be called by applications if a API call is being made from a behavior class., apiCallStarted(), isAPICallInProgress()

      • evaluateDynamicBinding

        public java.lang.String evaluateDynamicBinding(java.lang.String controlName,
                                               org.w3c.dom.Element modelElem)
        The mthod is called internally to evaluate the dynamic binding on the controls. Presently, dyanmic binding is supported for following type of controls:

        • Text
        • Styled Text
        • Label
        • Link
        Parameters:
        controlName - The control name for which dynamic is to be computed.
        modelElem - The model element corresponding to the binding.
        Returns:
        The method should return a String value evaluated based on the control name and the model element.
        See Also:
        YRCBaseTextBindingData.setDynamic(boolean), YRCBaseTextBindingData.setDynamic(boolean), YRCLabelBindingData.setDynamic(boolean), YRCLinkBindingData.setDynamic(boolean)

      • registerStaticTargetBinding

                                           java.lang.String sourceBinding)
        Call this method to register the attributes required in target model. The target value to be populated is picked up from the source binding.
        Note
        : Presently it is not supported for tables.
        Parameters:
        targetBinding -
        sourceBinding -

      • addTableRows

        public void addTableRows(java.lang.String tableName,
                         int numberOfRows)
        Utility method to add rows to a table dynamically. By default, the new ow will be empty. To populate the table row with a deault value override the method: populateDefaultTableItemAttributes(String, Element)
        Parameters:
        tableName - The control name of the table for which the operation needs to be performed.
        numberOfRows - Number of rows that needs to be added.
        See Also:
        populateDefaultTableItemAttributes(String, Element)

      • populateDefaultTableItemAttributes

        public void populateDefaultTableItemAttributes(java.lang.String tableName,
                                               org.w3c.dom.Element element)
        Utility method to populate the newly added row with some default values. By default, the method does nothing. The newly created rows will be empty. Child classes should override this method if the new rows should be populated with some default value.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The control name of the table to which the row needs to be added.
        element - The element associated with the new table row.

        public void setControlEditable(java.lang.String controlName,
                               boolean editable)
        The method is required to set field editable/non-editable .This method can be used for a textbox/styledtext/CCombo.
        Parameters:
        controlName - Control name
        editable - Editable is "true" when the control needs to be made editable and "false" otherwise.

      • getActiveAPIContextList

        public java.util.ArrayList<YRCApiContext> getActiveAPIContextList()

      • uploadFile

        public final YRCFileUploadObject uploadFile(java.lang.String attachmentName,
                                            java.lang.String attachmentDesc,
                                            java.lang.String fieldName)
        This method has to be invoked to register a file for upload. The file is uploaded immediately if the File Upload Type is ONSELECT and uploaded at the time of API call if the file upload type is ONSUBMIT. File upload type can be set globally in yfs.properties or can be set on the controls binding data.This method returns an instance of YRCFileUploadObject which gives the uploadID which can be used to cancel or delete the file upload when it is in progress.
        Parameters:
        attachmentName - is the name of the file attachment. If it is not provided, it is defaulted to file name
        attachmentDesc - is the description about the file being uploaded,if any
        fieldName - is the text control's name which is capturing the location of the file which has to be uploaded. File upload start/end/error events will be fired to this control
        Returns:
        an instance of YRCFileUploadObject which has to be used to get the file upload ID
        See Also:
        for methods to configure file upload through a text control, YRCFileUploadObject

      • uploadFile

        public final YRCFileUploadObject uploadFile(java.lang.String tableName,
                                            org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                            java.lang.String columnProperty,
                                            org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control control,
                                            java.lang.String fileLocation,
                                            java.lang.String attachmentName,
                                            java.lang.String attachmentDesc)
        This method has to be invoked if a file has to be uploaded as part of a table of a screen. The file is uploaded immediately if the File Upload Type is ONSELECT and uploaded at the time of API call if the file upload type is ONSUBMIT. File upload type can be set globally in yfs.properties or can be set on the table column binding data.This method returns an instance of YRCFileUploadObject which gives the uploadID which can be used to cancel or delete the file upload when it is in progress.
        Parameters:
        tableName - is the name of the table on the screen, of which file being registered is part of.
        element - is the underlying element of the table, of which file being registered is part of
        columnProperty - is the underlying column of the element, of which file being registered is part of
        control - can be any control which wants to listen to upload start/end/error events
        fileLocation - is the location of the file on the client which has to be uploaded
        attachmentName - is the name of the file attachment. If it is not provided, it is defaulted to file name
        attachmentDesc - is the description about the file being uploaded,if any
        Returns:
        an instance of YRCFileUploadObject which has to be used to get the file upload ID
        See Also:
        for methods to configure file upload for a table column, YRCFileUploadObject

                               java.lang.String fieldName)

      • setUploadInProgress

        public void setUploadInProgress(boolean uploadInProgress)
        This method is intended to be used by Platform
        Parameters:
        uploadInProgress - to is true when a file upload in progress for this behavior

      • isFileUploadInProgress

        public boolean isFileUploadInProgress()
        This method can be invoked to check if a file upload is in progress. The method recursively verifies if file upload is in progress in any of the child behaviors as well. Ideally this method has to be invoked on the parent behavior
        Returns:
        true if file upload is in progress in any of the child behaviors, false otherwise

      • getPendingFiles

        public java.util.ArrayList<YRCFileUploadObject> getPendingFiles()
        This method can be invoked to get list of all files which needs to be uploaded.
        Returns:
        list of the files which needs to get uploaded

      • fileReset

        public void fileReset()
        This method will get invoked when a session time out occurs. Ideally, any files not persisted in the DB as part of an API, until the time of session time out has to uploaded again

      • getFileHandler

        public IYRCUploadHandler getFileHandler()
        This utility method has to be used to get the handler set for file upload and delete of file uploaded on the server
        Returns:
        handler set for file upload and delete of file uploaded
        See Also:
        IYRCUploadHandler

      • setFileHandler

        public void setFileHandler(IYRCUploadHandler fileHandler)
        This utility method has to be used to set a handler for file upload and delete of file uploaded on the server
        Parameters:
        fileHandler - set for file upload and delete of file uploaded
        See Also:

      • downloadFile

        public void downloadFile(java.lang.String fieldName,
                         java.lang.String apiName,
                         org.w3c.dom.Document apiInput,
                         org.w3c.dom.Document fileDownloadInput,
                         IYRCDownloadHandler handler)
        Utility method to download file from the Database
        Parameters:
        fieldName - is the name of the field which would listen to download start ,download error and download end events
        apiName - is the Name of the API which should be call for download Authorization
        apiInput - is the input xml for API which has to be called for API authorization
        fileDownloadInput - is the input to download the file - <FileAttachment FileAttachmenKey="" FileName="" TableName="" TableKey="" ColonyId="" TableType=""$gt; FileAttachmentKey is mandatory. TableType and ColonyId are required in special cases in case of MultiSchema
        handler - is an instance of fileDownloadInput to handle file download process

      • showCalendar

        public java.lang.String showCalendar(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                     YRCCalendarInputObj inputObj)
        Utility method to display the calendar window through extensibility. The selected value is returned back as a String. If a valid field name is specified, the date is set to the control.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - is the name of the control which is either text or label control.
        inputObj - is Calendar input object YRCCalendarInputObj. If the calendar input object is null, default calendar will be shown at the centre,with all dates enabled and current(today) date selected.
        Returns:
        date selected by the user using the Calendar.
        See Also:
        YRCCalendarInputObj
